content_html: An impromptu conversation over beers has led to the launch of the First Annual Fathers Day Lawnmower Race on June 14 at Moosehorn Lodge, organized by the Southside Lawnmower Racing Association. “I got invited over to Moosehorn Lodge. I’m friends with the owners there, and we were having a cold beer one evening,” said organizer Jay Wiebe. “I had blown up my lawn mower, and I decided I was going to put a quad engine in my lawn mower, and the owner of Moosehorn just popped up the idea, ‘Well, why don’t we start a lawn mower race thing?’” From that spur-of-the-moment idea, a fullscale community event was born. The race will be held the Saturday before Father’s Day to allow participants to spend the holiday itself with family. The event is shaping up to be more than just a race. “We’ve got quite the venue,” Wiebe said. “We’ve got a live band, the local live band Dead Horse Hill will be playing, and I might be adding another one to that list. We’ve got a food truck coming out, Grumpy Gal Grub, and we also have a couple of the local businesses like Tatalrose [Corner] Store and Takysie Resort. They are going to have booths there as well with some of their swag and snacks.” Safety is a priority. “There will be no blades allowed,” said Wiebe. The First Annual Fathers Day Lawnmower Race will be held at the Moosehorn Lodge on June 13. (Submitted photo/Lakes District News) “You are allowed to have your deck on your lawn mower, but there will be no blades.
